case.name: SZKET v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 1705 (7 November 2007)

citphrases.citphrase: appeals from decisions of the refugee review tribunal to the federal magistrate's court
time limits commence from actual (as opposed to deemed) notification of the decision
method by which actual notification is effected
giving a document to an authorised recipient is not effective actual notification for the purpose of s 477 of the migration act 1958 (cth)

actual notification to an applicant of a decision of the rrt must be accomplished by physical delivery to the applicant of a written statement prepared by the rrt in accordance with s 430(1) of the migration act 1958 (cth) ;
application to federal magistrates court out of time
appeal to federal court filed out of time

citances.sentence: 7 Before the Federal Magistrate the appellant claimed that the Tribunal had failed to comply with s 424A of the Migration Act 1958 (Cth) (the Act) and that the decision was affected by fraud by the migration agent. On 18 June 2007 the Federal Magistrate dismissed the application on the basis that it was incompetent due to s 477(1) of the Act ( SZKET v Minister for Immigration & Anor [2007] FMCA 1007). On 7 November 2007 Jacobson J allowed an appeal from the earlier decision of the Federal Magistrates Court. His Honour remitted the matter to the Federal Magistrates Court by following the Full Federal Court decision of Minister for Immigration & Citizenship v SZKKC [2007] FCAFC 105 ; (2007) 159 FCR 565 which required actual notification of the written statement required by s 430 of the Act ( SZKET v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 1705).

4 Section 477(1) requires " actual (as opposed to deemed) notification of the decision " of the Tribunal. And " actual notification " requires delivery by hand: Minister for Immigration & Citizenship v SZKKC [2007] FCAFC 105 at [37] , [2007] FCAFC 105 ; 159 FCR 565. See also SZKET v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 1705.

legistitles.title: MIGRATION ACT 1958
MIGRATION ACT 1958 - SECT 430 Refugee Review Tribunal to record its decisions etc.
MIGRATION ACT 1958 - SECT 477 Time limits on applications to the Federal Magistrates Court
